@SBAgov A7: Find a mentor or support group. Never stop learning - workshops & webinars are a great way to stay current. Make good use of resources like business centers at your local community college. For you accomplished entrepreneurs - be visible. Examples are important! #SBAchat https://t.co/G4MK8XBze9

@SBAgov A6: Arrange tables to bring diverse talents together to share ideas. Include table introductions and “get-to-know-you” exchanges. Table captains can spur conversation around specific topics. You can also partner people with like interests for small group discussions. #SBAchat https://t.co/HwSha4n1XS

@SBAgov A5: A good boss is a good listener. A great boss also knows how to inspire, motivate and delegate. Keep your employees in the loop and always be open to new, different ideas and approaches. #SBAchat https://t.co/lO5q2u9R3E

@SBAgov A4: Know what knowledge, skills and abilities you need in an employee as well as how they will fit into and add to the culture. Set clear, achievable goals and look for people who can work well independently or as part of a team. #SBAchat https://t.co/4yb11QQLle
@SBAgov A3: Develop procedures - identify the most urgent issues that you need to address first. Keep a running list of short-term and long-term goals. #SBAchat https://t.co/PIPqi6m1TZ

@SBAgov A2: Starting with a SWOT Analysis is a great way to understand the needs of your business. Respect all your employees as essential members of the team, and keep them engaged by listening to their ideas. A truly diverse team creates authentic engagement. #SBAchat https://t.co/1tokRC5Qwk

@SBAgov A1: Women tend to be results oriented, focused, natural creative problem solvers, and we can build strong relationships through networking. We tend to be good listeners and offer a different perspective, having had to fight for a voice. #SBAchat https://t.co/bM4Lh6JfyZ
